headline.main: Antibiotics During Pregnancy May Increase Child's Obesity Risk

docs.abstract: A new study reports that antibiotic use during pregnancy is associated with an increased risk for obesity in the child.
docs.snippet: A new study reports that antibiotic use during pregnancy is associated with an increased risk for obesity in the child.

docs.lead_paragraph: A request by a lawyer in the corruption case involving Malcolm A. Smith, a Democratic state senator, to postpone the trial because she was in the sixth month of a high-risk pregnancy was denied.

headline.main: Pregnant Lawyer Fails in Bid to Delay Trial
headline.print_headline: Pregnant Lawyer Fails in Bid to Delay Trial

docs.abstract: Federal Judge Kenneth M Karas denies request to delay corruption trial of Vincent Tabone, former vice chairman of Queens Republican Party, whose co-defendant is Democratic State Sen Malcolm A Smith; request was based on fact that Tabone's lawyer is in sixth month of high-risk pregnancy.
docs.snippet: A request by a lawyer in the corruption case involving Malcolm A. Smith, a Democratic state senator, to postpone the trial because she was in the sixth month of a high-risk pregnancy was denied.

docs.lead_paragraph: A bill that would impose some of the nation's most stringent abortion restrictions cleared an Ohio House committee Thursday after suddenly re-surfacing in the lame duck session.

headline.main: Ohio 'Heartbeat' Abortion Bill Gets Panel's OK
headline.print_headline: Ohio 'Heartbeat' Abortion Bill Gets Panel's OK

docs.snippet: A bill that would impose some of the nation's most stringent abortion restrictions cleared an Ohio House committee Thursday after suddenly re-surfacing in the lame duck session.

docs.lead_paragraph: The dusty, industrial town of Ciudad Frontera, Mexico, has moved from the far reaches of the global auto supply chain to the front lines of an investigation into why air bags from Takata Corp are blowing up with lethal force in accidents.

headline.main: Special Report: Plant With Troubled Past at Center of Takata Air Bag Probe
headline.print_headline: Special Report: Plant With Troubled Past at Center of Takata Air Bag Probe

docs.snippet: The dusty, industrial town of Ciudad Frontera, Mexico, has moved from the far reaches of the global auto supply chain to the front lines of an investigation into why air bags from Takata Corp are blowing up with lethal force in accidents.

docs.lead_paragraph: If American politicians are looking for a genuinely bipartisan issue to work together on, here’s a suggestion: invest in early education.
docs.abstract: Nicholas Kristof Op-Ed column urges lawmakers seeking bipartisan issue to push for major federal investment in early education, public policy that 71 percent of American voters say they would support; says real question is not whether United States can afford early education initiatives, but whether nation can afford not to provide them given studies showing their enormous economic and social benefits.
docs.snippet: If American politicians are looking for a genuinely bipartisan issue to work together on, here’s a suggestion: invest in early education.

docs.lead_paragraph: Two U.S. senators on Wednesday raised the possibility of a sixth fatality linked to Takata Corp air bags, announcing a news conference to introduce the sister of someone who died in an Arizona accident in 2003.

headline.main: Factbox: Takata Air Bag Linked to Deaths Worldwide
headline.print_headline: Factbox: Takata Air Bag Linked to Deaths Worldwide

docs.snippet: Two U.S. senators on Wednesday raised the possibility of a sixth fatality linked to Takata Corp air bags, announcing a news conference to introduce the sister of someone who died in an Arizona accident in 2003.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal jury in California awarded nearly $186 million to a San Diego area woman who sued AutoZone Inc. saying she was demoted and fired after being told pregnant women can't do the job of managing a store, court records showed.

headline.main: San Diego Jury Awards Woman $186 Million in Bias Case Against AutoZone
headline.print_headline: San Diego Jury Awards Woman $186 Million in Bias Case Against AutoZone

docs.snippet: A federal jury in California awarded nearly $186 million to a San Diego area woman who sued AutoZone Inc. saying she was demoted and fired after being told pregnant women can't do the job of managing a store, court records showed.

headline.main: Chasing Entrepreneurial Opportunity in the Affordable Care Act

docs.abstract: The Affordable Care Act has opened up entrepreneurial opportunities for start-ups like Stride Health, a recommendation engine for health insurance.
docs.snippet: The Affordable Care Act has opened up entrepreneurial opportunities for start-ups like Stride Health, a recommendation engine for health insurance.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

headline.main: It's a Boy, and It's Okay to Be Disappointed

docs.abstract: When the ultrasound technician found that white blob between the legs of my baby on the computer screen, I cried.
docs.snippet: When the ultrasound technician found that white blob between the legs of my baby on the computer screen, I cried.
